characters: OMITTED SCENE COMBINED WITH SCENE 25B BELOW 25
FROM THE LIBRARY ROOFTOP ACROSS THE STREET
ON THE CRATER'S EDGE ABOVE THEM

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: On the blackness of SPACE, beautiful and mysterious, stre with a billion stars. Atop a building, a wrought-iron sign -- a HAMMER-WIELDING BLACKSMITH -- spins listlessly in the wind as a swirling breeze kicks up. A hint of what's to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A main street extends before us in this one-horse town, s amid endless flat, arid scrubland. A large SUV slowly mov down the street and heads out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV sits parked in the desert. Suddenly, the roof pan of the SUV FOLD OPEN. The underside of the panels house a variety of hand-built ASTRONOMICAL DEVICES, which now poi at the sky. JANE FOSTER (late 20's) pops her head through the roof. S positions a MAGNETOMETER, so its monitor calibrates with constellations above. It appears to be cobbled together f spare parts of other devices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! We hear a loud BANG followed by muffled CURSING from belo Jane offers a hand down to ERIK SELVIG (60) who emerges a well, rubbing his head.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh-- watch your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So what's this "anomaly" of yours supposed to look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little different each time. Once it looked like, I don't know, melted stars, pooling in a corner of the sky. But last week it was a rolling rainbow ribbon--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Racing "round Orion?" I've always said you should have been a poet. Jane reigns in her excitement. She tries for dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 1A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Darcy. Pass up the bubbly and my gloves, will you? Intern DARCY LEWIS (20) hands Jane a bottle of Champagne a pair of gloves through the window. Jane passes it to Selvig to hold while she pulls on the old gloves -- too l and masculine for her small hands. He starts to unwrap th foil, and she stops his hand with an excited grin.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not until you see it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the gloves) I recognize those. Think how proud he'd be to see you now. Jane's grin fades to a sad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The benefit of the doubt. The two stare out at the sky expectantly. A long beat whi they scan the skies. Nothing. Jane's worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 2.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's never taken this long before. Darcy calls up from the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Can I turn on the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an edge to her voice) Sure, if you like rocking out to KFRM, "All agriculture, all the time." Worried, Jane heads back down into the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV is bathed in the glow of high-tech monitoring equipment and laptops, some looking like they're held together with duct tape. Jane opens a well-worn NOTEBOOK handwritten notes and calculations. Selvig watches the frustrated Jane with sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anomalies are always precipitated by geomagnetic storms. She shows him a complicated CHART she's drawn in the book tracking occurrences and patterns.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The last seventeen occurrences have been predictable to the minute... I just don't understand. Something catches Darcy's eye out the driver's side mirro She adjusts it. In the distance, ODD GLOWING CLOUDS form the skies over the Northeastern end of the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane? Jane SHUSHES her, leafs through her notes. The bottle of champagne begins to vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be some new variable... Or an equipment malfunction... The lights and equipment in the SUV begin to FLICKER arou them. The computer monitors SQUELCH with static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 2A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think there's anything wrong with your equipment... The champagne bottle starts to RATTLE noisily now as it shakes more violently. Jane and Selvig notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 3. They watch it curiously, pressure building up inside it, the cork EXPLODES out of it. Champagne goes spewing everywhere -- over equipment, over Jane.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you want to see this. Darcy points out the window. Jane and Selvig look out. Ov the desert --

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE CLOUDS OF RAINBOW LIGHT
dialogues.text: Churn in the sky. The three stare, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy. Shatner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your "subtle" aurora?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- yes! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof panels still open, the SUV races towards the str event, Jane, amazed by the sight, stands with half her bo out the roof, taking video of the light storm before them The SUV hits a bump. Jane nearly flies out. Selvig grabs her, yanks her back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane grins, thrilled, pumped with adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this great?! A thought strikes her.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're seeing it too, right? I'm not crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's debateable. Put your seat belt on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 3A. The SUV lurches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winds HOWL around the SUV now. Up ahead, spiraling down f out of the clouds comes --

dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS TORNADO
dialogues.text: Suffuse with the strange rainbow light, ROARING like a thousand freight trains as it touches down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selvig looks up through the still-open sunroof at the enormous glowing funnel cloud with wonder. Jane clambers into the front seat, beside Darcy. She leans way out the window, TAPING the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta get us closer so I can take a magnetic reading. Darcy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right! Good one! (then, realizing) Oh God, you're serious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want those college credits or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV tears across a field towards the tornado, Jane leaning out the window, taping the event. The SUV disturb two RAVENS perched on a cactus as they race past. The bir take flight, when -- KRAKABOOM! A huge BOLT OF LIGHTNING strikes down through the center of the funnel cloud befor them with a terrifying intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV rocks from the blast. Darcy's had enough. She tur the wheel, starts to head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the credits. I'll intern at Burger King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving our lives! Jane grabs the wheel, jerks it hard the other way. They struggle for control, when the headlights fall on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 5. Directly in their path, stumbling through the winds. Darc slams on the brakes, Jane turns the wheel hard to avoid h The SUV swerves -- but too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side of the SUV slams into the man with a THUD, sendi him flying. The car SKIDS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, Darcy, and Selvig trade shocked looks, breathing ha They peer through the dust clouds, unable to see through. A paralyzed moment, then they all leap out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three race from the SUV with flashlights. Jane spots man lying on the ground. He's dressed in tattered clothin charred and blackened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was legally your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the first aid kit. Darcy heads back inside the SUV as Jane, concerned, kneel next to the man. Selvig hovers, protectively. She gently turns his head to the light, and we see him clearly for the first time. He is magnificently handsome, long blonde hair flowing around his classically sculpted features. She cups her hands around his face, as if willi the life back into him.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, big guy. Do me a favor and don't be dead, okay? Open your eyes and look at me. Suddenly, he GROANS, and she's startled, then relieved, a his eyes flutter open. She looks deep into his confused, azure eyes, which at last focus on her own. Locking onto them. For a moment, they each forget to breathe. The connection is broken as Darcy returns with the kit. S freezes when she sees how gorgeous the man is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 5A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Does he need CPR? Because I know CPR. A flustered Jane smooths her hair and sits back on her he She looks up at Selvig. Back to being a scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --are beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --are dilating. That's a good sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have to get him to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we get a reading on the storm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately, Jane. Jane sighs and nods, regretfully watching the storm EVAPO above their heads. A thought strikes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he come from? They exchange puzzled looks, as we move up through the la glowing remnants of the storm, and into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EARTH spins slowly before us as we hear a voice, deep and resonant -- the voice of HEIMDALL, Gatekeeper of Asgard.

dialogues.speaker: HEIMDALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Questions, they've always asked questions -- this race called man, on this planet they call earth. Passionately longing to know how they are connected to the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 6. We pull away from the planet, widening, past other worlds cosmic debris -- leaving first our solar system, then our galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: HEIMDALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In ages past, they looked to us as gods, for indeed so many times we saved them from calamity. We tried to show them how their world was but one of the Nine Realms of the Cosmos, linked to all others by the branches of Yggdrasil... We pull back until we see it -- YGGDRASIL. Immense, sprawling, like a quasar or a nebula twisted into the vag shape of a TREE, its branches of glowing energy stretchin out into the black void of space.

dialogues.speaker: HEIMDALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...the Worlds Tree. Nine Realms in a universe of wonder, beauty, and terror that they barely comprehended. We move in through Yggdrasil, until we reach what looks l a galaxy, slowly spinning before us.

dialogues.speaker: HEIMDALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But for all their thirst for knowledge, they let our lessons fall into myth and dreams. Where did he come from? He came from us, the proudest race of warriors the Worlds have ever seen. He came from this -- the greatest Realm the universe has ever known. We move through the galaxy's mists and astral matter, the over and up, through a band of prismatic color to reveal what's on the other side:

dialogues.speaker: HEIMDALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He came... from Asgard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful beyond imagination. We fly over the magnificent landscape of the Realm, through the gleaming capital city modern yet timeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 6A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The palace rises countless stories tall, gleaming with an other-worldly majesty, towering high above the Realm spra out before it. We move towards a large window of the palace, where a FIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares out at his kingdom. The ravens fly up to the balco land at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin turns away from the window. His wife FRIGGA sits at vanity and tries different earrings before the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks he is. He has his father's confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll need his father's wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his humility? Odin reacts.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thor won't be alone. Loki will be at his side to give him counsel. Have faith in your sons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but Thor's still a boy. He could be a great King... Odin stops, notices HIS HAND SHAKING. It seems to be out synch temporally with the rest of the world, leaving a tr as it moves. He stares at it determinedly, concentrating, trying to stop the strange event through the force of his sheer will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 8. Finally, the occurrence subsides, his hand normal once mo A worried Frigga covers his hand with her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...if we only had more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once, our son needs something we cannot provide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fight it a little longer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You've put it off too long! I worry for you. He touches her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've destroyed demons and monsters, devastated whole worlds, laid waste to mighty kingdoms, and still you worry for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. Now come kiss your king... while I'm still king. He pulls her close, and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly under the throne room, a gloomily lit hall. Bann hang on either side to form a corridor down the middle of fire lit room. Giant doors open at one end. A huge figure silhouetted against the bright light beyond walks forward. In slo-mo, recognize the unmistakable shape of the God of Thunder. Hammer in hand, he reaches the end of a raised platform. An ATTENDANT hands the figure a goblet of wine. He downs it quickly, hurls it towards the fire directly below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 8A. The cup smashes, the alcohol causes the fire to glow intensely -- and, for a moment, brightly lit, and seen fu length, like a King to be, is THE MIGHTY THOR. He proceeds down stops, past camera, and down the center the Hall. We follow from behind and see at the other end, massively shadowed on one of the great banners, the shape of two gr horns. As Thor approaches, the horn shapes move, and then from the shadows at the side, emerges LOKI, wearing his horned headpiece. Like Thor, he is dressed for a great ceremony. They stand a brazier at the foot of steps that lead up to the crowde throne room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous, brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever known me to be nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was the time in Nornheim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't nerves, brother. It was the rage of battle. How else could I have fought my way through a hundred warriors and pulled us out alive? The Attendant approaches with another goblet of wine for Thor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I recall, I was the one who veiled us in smoke to ease our escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some do battle, others just do tricks. The Attendant stifles a laugh. Loki notices, doesn't like it. He gestures towards the goblet in the Attendant's han EELS pour over the sides of the goblet, slithering out an across the terrified Attendant's hand. He SCREAMS, hurls goblet to the ground. Loki chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Loki... Loki gestures to the writhing eels on the ground. They tu back to spilled wine, the illusion shattered.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now that was just a waste of good wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bit of fun. (to the Attendant) Right, my friend? The Attendant isn't so sure. Thor dons his EAGLE-WINGED HELMET.

dialogues.speaker: LOKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Thor's helmet) Nice feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 9A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't really want to start this again, do you, Cow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was being sincere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're incapable of sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? He looks his brother in the eye, all pretense lost.

dialogues.speaker: LOKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've looked forward to this day as long as you have. You're my brother and my friend. Sometimes I'm envious, but never doubt that I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 10. Thor searches his brother's face, sees no trace of irony. He's either speaking from his heart or he's a very, very liar. Maybe both. Thor puts an appreciative hand on his brother's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The two brothers take in the moment a beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Thor makes the final adjustments to his ceremonial wear.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a king. They hear the blast of a CEREMONIAL HORN.

dialogues.speaker: LOKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go ahead. Loki casts him a wary look.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be along. Go on. Loki heads inside the palace without his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOLSTAGG combs his great beard in preparation for the big event. As he does, he's surprised to find a stray GRAPE stuck in the beard. He pulls it out, looks around, then eagerly pops it into his mouth and gobbles it down. FANDRAL checks his reflection in a mirror, smooths out hi moustache, gives himself a dashing smile. A PRETTY MAIDEN holds the mirror before him, as other MAIDENS look on dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, love. (to the Maidens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 10A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who'd like to polish my sword for me? The giddy Maidens eagerly raise their hands. HOGUN stands staring ahead grimly, his hands folded in fr of him, amidst the hustle and bustle of the ATTENDANTS an the ceremony preparations going on around him. A HELPFUL ATTENDANT approaches him and starts to polish his armor. Hogun turns his head, gives him a look. Intimidated, the Attendant quickly backs away. From behind, we see a WOMAN IN CEREMONIAL ARMOR take off SWORD and set it on a table, then her SHIELD, then severa HIDDEN DAGGERS and small, yet intimidating WEAPONS. We reveal that it's SIF, looking radiant. She eyes the weapo on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the weapons) I'll miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colorful CEREMONIAL BANNERS of the Nine Realms adorn the room, crowded with AESIR and REPRESENTATIVES from across Yggdrasil, all BUZZING with excitement. Thor's COMRADES enter and stride to their place of honor the front of the hall. They are:

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS THREE
dialogues.text: VOLSTAGG has the girth and strength of a Sumo wrestler, w oversized passions to match. FANDRAL, the consummate swashbuckler, is agile, charismatic, and nattily dressed. HOGUN -- dark, sullen, brooding -- a large MACE slung at side. With them walks the warrior maiden SIF. She's clad in arm a shield and sword at her side -- a beauty not to be trif with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope this goes quickly. I'm famished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you attached to that pretty face of yours? Because one more word, and you won't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) My, we are hungry, aren't we? The others laugh, save Hogun. Fandral turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: FANDRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on, Hogun. Smile. You can do it. Even you, Hogun the Grim. Just one smile. Hogun stares at him grimly.

dialogues.speaker: FANDRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, half a smile. Look, forget the smile, just show some teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fandral, is it true the famous Warriors Three are ready to meet any challenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it, Lady Sif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imposing EINHERJAR GUARDS clad in armor, swords at the re stand watch inside the massive underground structure bene the palace. A cold BREEZE blows past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor stands, his fingers nervously drumming the handle of hammer. Frigga approaches behind him, sees his anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right to be nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does everyone keep saying that? I'm not nervous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be able to fool the rest of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but never you. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor, just remember that you have something even the great Allfather never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me for a mother. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now don't keep your father waiting. Frigga leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sif and the Warriors Three still wait before the crowd. L and Frigga enter. Loki takes his place at the front of th hall alongside the others. With another blast of the horn the crowd goes silent as the EINHERJAR HONOR GUARD moves formation. They part to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 12A. Sitting atop his throne, clad in full ceremonial armor. H holds his spear GUNGNIR before him. Any trace of weakness him is gone now. He exudes all the power and majesty of a Ruler of Asgard. Frigga joins him at his side. He looks around the hall, casts a glance over to the Warriors. Thor is nowhere to b seen. Odin looks to Loki. Loki shrugs. Odin isn't pleased A murmur spreads through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Loki) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'd be along. Sif realizes the truth, shakes her head in disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to make an entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if he doesn't show up soon, he shouldn't bother. Odin looks like he's ready to feed him to his ravens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry. Father will forgive him. He always does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 13. Just then, at the back of the hall, up the steps from the lower level --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roars up into the hall, Thor strides cockily into the hal behind it, catching it behind his back. The CROWD erupts CHEERS. Thor spins his hammer with a flourish, holds it u before the crowd, basking in the moment, relishing the adoration, whipping his audience up into a frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Odin watches from the front, not liking this showy displa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sound of the cheers echo from above, the odd, cold breeze picks up in the Vault. The Guards rub their limbs warm themselves. They grow increasingly uneasy, sensing something's not right. They exchange a look, then walk the length of the Vault's hallway to its end, where a CASKET sits undisturbed upon pedestal. LARGE SHADOWS suddenly loom over them. They look up and SHOUT in terror as they raise their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor finishes stirring up the crowd, then reaches the fro of the room, kneels on one knee before his mother and fat Frigga casts him an admonishing glance. Thor winks up at her. She can't help but smile. Odin strikes Gungnir upon the ground with a deafening BOO The crowd falls silent. Odin speaks with quiet, effortles authority. He raises Gungnir before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gungnir. Its aim is true, its power strong. With it I have defended Asgard and the lives of the innocent across the Nine Realms since the time of the Great Beginning. And though the day has come for a new King to wield his own weapon -- that duty remains the same. Thor Odinson, my heir, my first-born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 13A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long entrusted with this mighty hammer, Mjolnir. Forged in the heart of a dying star, from the sacred metal of Uru. Only one may lift it. Only one is worthy. Who wields this hammer commands the lightning and the storm. Its power has no equal -- as a weapon, to destroy, or as a tool, to build. It is a fit companion for a King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodies of the Guards are flung to the Vault's floor, strewn with ice. We don't see their attackers clearly, ju catch glimpses of them in the shadows -- but they are lar and BLUE-SKINNED. One of the creatures lifts the Casket off its stand and t to go. But, as they do, the intricate latticework behind Casket starts to separate and retract, revealing somethin standing in the shadows behind it. As the creatures walk away, a fiery glow rises behind the They turn back around. Now it's their turn to SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ceremony continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today I entrust you with the greatest honor in all the Nine Realms. The sacred throne of Asgard. I have sacrificed much to achieve peace. So, too, must a new generation sacrifice to maintain that peace. Responsibility, duty, honor. These are not merely virtues to which we must aspire. They are essential to every soldier and to every King. The Crowd and the Warriors Three start to shiver and rub their limbs for warmth in the increasingly cold air of th hall. Thor turns back to face his father. Odin looks upon his s with pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 15.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thor Odinson, do you swear to guard the Nine Realms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear to preserve the peace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear to cast aside all selfish ambition and pledge yourself only to the good of all the Realms? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then on this day, I, Odin Allfather, proclaim you-- Odin hesitates, noticing a strange sight before him. ICE creeps across the surface of the large banners around the hall, making an eerie CRACKING sound. Thor, his comrades, and the crowd see it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost giants... The far-off sounds of a BATTLE echo in the depths of the palace below. Sif and the Warriors Three reach for their weapons, as Thor races from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor enters, then stares shocked at the sight before him. Sif, the Warriors Three, and Loki hurry in behind Thor an stop short. Shattered and melting ICE is strewn about the floor. We don't see the blue-skinned bodies of the Frost Giants clearly, just catch glimpses of their twisted and smolder remains on the floor. They've just lost a savage battle. Badly. Amidst them, shrouded in shadow, stands the black metal creature, a fiery glow coming from within it. It is THE DESTROYER. It holds the Casket in its hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Destroyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was but a legend. Odin steps in behind the Asgardians, as the Destroyer set the Casket back on its pedestal. It moves back to its pos the faint, FIERY GLOW extinguishes within it. Fandral looks around the Vault, ill at ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been inside the Vault before. It's said the Tesseract was once held here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tesseract? I thought that was but a legend too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush! Odin surveys the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jotuns must pay for what they've done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 16A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have paid with their lives. The Destroyer did its job, and the Casket is safe. All is well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All is well?!" They broke into the Weapons Vault! If the Frost Giants had stolen even one of these

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know why they--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Casket of Ancient Winters belonged to the Jotuns. They believe it's their birthright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you hadn't taken it from them they would have laid waste to all the Nine Realms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a truce with Laufey, the Jotun King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just broke your truce! We must act! Odin turns to Sif and the Warriors Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us. Thor's comrades exit. Odin eyes Thor, as Loki watches.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what action would you take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March into Jotunheim as you once did, teach them a lesson, break their spirits so they'll never dare try to cross our borders again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking only as a warrior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 16B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was an act of war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the act of but a few, doomed to fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got this far!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will find the breach in our defenses. It will be found, and it will be sealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As King of Asgard, I would--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not King. Not yet. Thor sees in his father's face that he's pushed this as f as he can. He backs away, then leaves, pushing through th doors so hard that they SLAM backwards behind him. Odin watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor stands in the empty hall, bearing the signs of the festivities cancelled due to the events of the day. Anger and frustration rising within him, Thor upends one of the massive tables. From across the room, Loki watches him.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BANQUET HALL ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Sif, Fandral, and Hogun follow Volstagg as he enters in search of his dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redecorating, are we? Volstagg surveys the overturned tables and food, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this -- ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you they'd cancel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought that was just you being your normal cheery self. Volstagg looks about the floor, despairing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this food -- so innocent, cast to the ground. It breaks the heart! Thor strides away from them to the far end of the hall. L calmly moves towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unwise to be in my company right now, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I was wise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the empty hall) This was to be my day of triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will come. In time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's any consolation, I think you're right. About the Frost Giants, about Laufey, everything. If a few of them could penetrate the defenses of Asgard once, who's to say they won't try again. Next time with an army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's nothing we can do without defying Father. Thor considers this, looks at his hammer, a gleam in his Loki can guess what he's thinking, grows concerned.

dialogues.speaker: LOKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... stop there! I know that look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way to ensure the safety of our borders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's madness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madness? What sort of madness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! Thor was making a jest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The safety of our Realm is no jest. We're going to Jotunheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor, of all the laws of Asgard, this is one you must not break. Loki looks on, intrigued by the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't like a journey to Earth, where you summon a little lightning and thunder and the mortals worship you as a god. This is Jotunheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if the Frost Giants don't kill you, your Father will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father fought his way into Jotunheim, defeated their armies, and took their Casket! We'd just be looking for answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is forbidden! Thor sizes up his friends, smiles. He proceeds to make hi case with enthusiasm and charismatic conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends, have you forgotten all that we've done together? He turns to Fandral.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who brought you into the sweet embrace of the most exotic maidens in all of Yggdrasil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who led you into the most glorious of battles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and to delicacies so succulent, you thought you'd died and gone to Valhalla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 19A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. / You did. He turns to Sif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who proved wrong all who scoffed at the idea that a young maiden could be one of the fiercest warriors this Realm has ever known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. But I supported you... (then, to the others) My friends, trust me now. We must do this. The others exchange concerned looks, realize there's no convincing him.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. You're not going to let my brother and me take all the glory, are you? Loki looks startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are coming with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course! I won't let my brother march into Jotunheim alone. I will be at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I. The Warriors Three fight together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fear we'll live to regret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor, Sif, Loki, and the Warriors Three walk from the Pal across the grounds. They reach a group of ATTENDANTS who ready their battle gear for their journey. Loki slips away from the group, speaks to a nearby GUARD. Hogun notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must first find a way to get past Heimdall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will be no easy task. It's said the Gatekeeper can see a single dew drop fall from a blade of grass a thousand worlds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he can hear a cricket passing gas in Niffelheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jest not! He heareth all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Getting past him should be simple enough now, since he seems to be letting Frost Giants sneak by under his nose. Volstagg, terrified, calls out to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive him! He meaneth no offense! Loki rejoins the group as Thor leads them onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 20A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor and his band of adventurers, on horseback, pass thro the massive Gate, leaving Asgard behind. They ride along most astounding path in this Realm or any other -- THE RAINBOW BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 21. Wide and flat, it runs straight out from Odin's palace to mists and black void of space beyond. In the distance far ahead, the Bridge continues on until it reaches Heimdall' Observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band draws near the Observatory, where HEIMDALL himse Gatekeeper of Asgard, stands at his post on the Bridge be them, blocking their way, staring them down. There is something other-worldly about him, even for this Realm. He holds a massive sword in front of him, his ster intimidating face virtually concealed by armor. Something glints beneath his visor, like twinkling stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your weapons sheathed and your mouths closed. This is going to take subtlety and sincerity, not brute strength. Leave it to me. Loki dismounts and steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not dressed warmly enough. Thor, Loki, and the others trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freezing cold of Jotunheim. It will kill you all in time, even Thor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can deceive me? I, who watch all? I, who can sense the flapping of a butterfly's wings a thousand worlds away? He fixes his eyes pointedly at Fandral.

dialogues.speaker: HEIMDALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or can hear a cricket passing gas in Niffelheim? Fandral looks gob-smacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was just a bit of a jest, really... Loki goes into damage control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be mistaken. We're not--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heimdall, may we pass? Heimdall stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For ages have I guarded Asgard and kept it safe from those who would do it harm. In all that time, never has an enemy slipped by my watch -- until this day. I wish to know how that happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell no one where we've gone until we've returned. Thor walks past Heimdall as the Gatekeeper lets the group pass. Volstagg walks beside the frustrated Loki, needles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Your silver tongue turn to lead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me off this bridge before it cracks under your girth. Volstagg and Fandral share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor and the others enter the Observatory, step onto a platform. Heimdall climbs into the large control apparatu at the center of the room and readies the Observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be warned. I will honor my sworn oath to protect this Realm as its Gatekeeper. If your return threatens the safety of Asgard, Bifrost will remain closed to you. You'll be left to die in the cold wastes of Jotunheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no plans to die today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None do. Heimdall inserts his sword into the control panel, and th apparatus of the Observatory starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bifrost energy quickens along the Bridge, feeding int the Observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heimdall turns his sword in the control panel. The Observatory's giant turret swings around, aims toward a section of space. As a final step, Heimdall plunges his sword deeper into the control panel. The great turret FIR the RAINBOW LIGHT of Bifrost energy blasts out of it. The Bifrost opens at the end of the platform upon which T and his five comrades stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is ready. You may pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you just leave the bridge open for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep this bridge open would unleash the full power of the Bifrost and destroy Jotunheim with you upon it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Never mind, then. Thor starts towards the Bifrost, turns back to the others grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 23A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Don't be bashful. The others join him at his side, then step towards the Bifrost. Their bodies stretch towards the maelstrom, changing shape, as if every atom of their being is being elongated by the pull of it. In an instant, they're jerke off the platform and inside the vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole in the sky rips open, and the Bifrost comes shooti out of it. Snow flurries up when the Bifrost hits, as Tho and his band touch down. RUNES from the Bifrost are imprinted on the ice around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 24. Volstagg loses his footing, falling backwards. Thor quick grabs him by the belt. We see the warrior dangling precariously on the edge of a sheer cliff on the planet's inner ring, opening up to the black abyss of space beyond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, big fella. Up...! With an effort, Thor pulls the burly warrior back onto th ice and, tremendously relieved, he proclaims:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This belt! This belt is now my lucky belt! I will never remove it! Even when bathing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bathe? Thor and the others turn and stare out in horror and wond at the frozen alien wasteland before them. The whole plan is a massive flattened ring of jagged ice, slowly breakin apart. Huge CHUNKS OF ICE calve away from its outer edges and float off into space. The planet's icy surface cracks and melts as far as the eye can see. The ruins of a Jotun city lies in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's not. We could turn right around, hop back to Asgard, share a mug by the fire. Could be nice. Thor ignore him, heads off. Loki looks around, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should wait. Thor turns back to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To survey the enemy. To gauge their strengths and weaknesses from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm liking that. Gauging, surveying. Particularly the distance part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know all we must. It's time to act. Thor heads on. Reluctantly, the others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just got to swing his hammer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group trudges behind Thor across the frozen wasteland shielding themselves from the howling wind and cold. Loki looks around them, anxious. Volstagg shivers. Thor, invigorated, turns back to his comrades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels good, doesn't it? To be together again, adventuring on another world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adventuring? Is that what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a song to lift our spirits? The others groan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 25A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't make us sing again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have to listen to Volstagg's singing voice one more time, I'll fall on my own sword!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now I'm on board. She and Thor share a grin. The party reaches the edge of the city -- its ancient structures of jade and ice melting and crumbling, ravaged warfare long ago. A TEMPLE lies before them, across a central plaza.

dialogues.speaker: SIF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding. As cowards always do. Thor leads the others onwards towards the central plaza. Loki reluctantly follows. They don't notice as SHADOWY FIGURES move in the shadows of the structures nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party reaches the plaza. They sense the Frost Giants the shadows and crevices, surrounding them now on all sid The Asgardians reach for the hilts of their weapons. A JOTUN SENTRY calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your business here, Asgardian? The Jotun's voice itself sounds like cracking ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I speak only to your King. Not to his foot soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: JOTUN VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Then speak. Thor turns towards the source in a balcony of the temple, where LAUFEY sits, veiled in shadow, behind a cascading waterfall. The Jotun King is ancient, noble, powerful -- proud to reveal even a hint of the years of suffering he his people have endured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Laufey, King of this Realm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know who you are, Odinson. Why have you brought the stench of your blood into my world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand answers. Laufey stands, sizing up Thor, tries to piece this togeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You "demand?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did your people get into Asgard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house of Odin is full of traitors. Sif and the Warriors Three exchange a puzzled look, distu by the Jotun King's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not dishonor my father's name with your lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father is a murderer and a thief. He stole what was ours, and left our world in ruins. We have the right to reclaim the Casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when you'd use it to make war against other Realms. Laufey laughs, cold, mocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why have you come here? To make peace? You long for battle. You crave it. I see you for what you are, Thor Odinson. Nothing but a boy, trying to prove himself a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy has grown tired of your mockery. Thor takes a step towards Laufey. The other Jotuns step i front of Thor, blocking his path. We finally see the Fros Giants now -- terrifying, blue-skinned, standing eight fe tall. Loki moves next to his brother and quietly implores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor, stop and think. Look around you. We are outnumbered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know your place, brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should listen to his counsel. You know not what your actions would unleash. Laufey steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: LAUFEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I do. Go now, while I still allow it. Thor simmers. Loki speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will accept your most gracious offer. The others look to Thor imploringly. Thor stares Laufey d a beat -- then relents. He turns to leave. His comrades breathe a sigh of relief and follow, when a Frost Giant nearby mutters under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run back home, little princess. Thor stops in his tracks. Loki goes white. He knows what' coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. In one quick move, Thor pulls Mjolnir, swings it, and KNO the Jotun clear across the plaza. The Asgardians reluctan draw their weapons, gather into a circle around Thor. Volstagg looks around at the angry Jotuns approaching the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly hammer! Has a mind of its own! ICE forms on the Jotuns' bodies, creating a FROZEN ARMOR around them, extending off the ends of their arms like SWORDS. One Giant does so directly in front of Fandral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hoping that's just decorative. Thor leaves the circle of Asgardians, swings at another F Giant. His comrades form another circle around him, separating him from the Jotuns, as he whirls his hammer around once and catches it with a cocky grin. He's enjoyi this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next! Fandral calls to Volstagg and Hogun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What move, do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we use "The Norn's Revenge."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this close range? I think "The Alfheim Lunge" is a better move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if they were three feet tall! No! How about "The Randy Valkyrie"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 28A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Thor takes out yet another Frost Giant, then all hell bre loose as the Asgardians and Jotuns begin to battle. A Jotun backs Hogun up against a wall of ice. As the Gian hurls an ice blade fist at him, the grim warrior swings h mace over his head, embedding it into the ice wall, and hoists himself up, dodging the Giant's blow and leaping o him. Hogun takes out a second approaching Frost Giant, sp back, dodges a swing from the first, then pounds the Jotu with his mace. Nearby, Sif expertly stabs one Jotun after another with h double-bladed staff. One knocks her viciously to the grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't treat me like a lady, I won't act like a lady! She takes out the Jotun. Loki backs away from an approaching Jotun, finds himself the edge of a deep crevasse. The Giant sees he's vulnerab swipes at him. But the Jotun's arm passes right through h The Giant stands there, confused, when THE REAL LOKI come out from behind a structure and shoves the Giant into the crevasse below. The false Loki dissipates into nothingnes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the falling Giant) Pathetic. He turns back to the battle. Two Jotuns come at him from either side. He lets two daggers fly, felling both Giants once. Laufey nods to one of his guards -- a massive Jotun BRUTE The Brute leaps down from the balcony, icing himself up, punches his giant fist into the ice beneath his feet. It' long-range attack, causing PILLARS OF ICE to explode out front of Hogun, sending the grim warrior flying back. Across the plaza, Thor easily dispatches some Jotuns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! At least make it a challenge for me! He sees the Brute coming at him. The huge Jotun lands a tremendous blow, sending Thor back across the ice. Thor rises, grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 28B.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now that's more like it! He throws Mjolnir with all his strength, knocking the Bru head over heels. Thor raises his hand. Mjolnir slows in mid-air, then flie back to his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: the fallen Brute) Ugly and stupid. Sif takes out a couple Frost Giants, but she's knocked to ground by another. It raises its weapon above her. Hogun sees Sif in danger. He pulls a HIDDEN KNIFE from hi sleeve and hurls it at Sif's attacker, hitting him square the chest. The Jotun falls dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hogun, re: knife) I'm so glad I taught him how to do that! Volstagg grapples with a Frost Giant, getting a couple go hits in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may want to put some ice on that! The Frost Giant fights back, but Volstagg manages to grip a headlock just as another comes up on him from behind. Volstagg fends him off, then turns the first one loose.

dialogues.speaker: VOLSTAGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You may be taller, but I'm wider! Volstagg launches his mighty belly at the Jotun and sends flying. Another Jotun grabs Volstagg, squeezing him tightly and sending him crashing to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: VOLSTAGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not too late for you to surrender. Volstagg recovers and fights on. The Jotun grabs Volstagg bare arm. The warrior's skin begins to freeze from the Jotun's grasp, a BLACKNESS spreading from it, necrotizing Volstagg's flesh. The warrior SHOUTS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 28C. Volstagg head-butts the Frost Giant, shattering the Jotun ice helmet and dropping him to the ground. Winded, he takes a seat upon one of the fallen Jotun's bo to catch his breath. As the battle rages around him, he opens a secret compartment at the end of his weapon, take out a small FLASK. Volstagg grimaces in pain, sees his blackened skin. He ye to his comrades.

dialogues.speaker: VOLSTAGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't let them grab hold of you! He takes a swig, enjoying the brief respite, then rejoins battle. Volstagg stabs his blade in a Giant's chest, but the swor stops mid ice layer. The Giant delivers a bone-breaking blow to Volstagg's fac and the warrior drops to one knee. Sif sees Volstagg in trouble and rushes towards him. In o quick move, she leaps up and off of Volstagg's back, usin her boot to plunge Volstagg's blade deep into the Giant's chest, standing atop him as he falls backwards to the gro

dialogues.speaker: VOLSTAGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on his belly) Thank you, my lady. But I nearly had him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you did. Nearby, a Frost Giant forms a BARRAGE OF ICE BULLETS, hur them at Sif. Sif raises her shield barely in time, as the bullets go pinging and ricocheting off it. She races into the group of Frost Giants who attacked her and takes them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 29. A Frost Giant touches a pool of standing water. It FLASH- FREEZES Hogun's feet to the ground. Volstagg notices, hurries over, dispatching Jotuns as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on! Volstagg swings his weapon, wildly hacking at the ice aro Hogun's legs to free him. Hogun looks down, suddenly worried, as Volstagg's blade cuts deep -- and perilously close to hacking into Hogun's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the legs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry. Volstagg chips away at the ice more carefully, finally freeing Hogun's feet. Fandral sword fights with a Frost Giant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think your icicles are a match for Asgardian steel? Fandral lunges at the Giant. The Jotun knocks his blade away.

dialogues.speaker: FANDRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Fandral moves on him again, but the Giant grabs Fandral's sword and snaps it in half.

dialogues.speaker: FANDRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could we stop just a moment while I get another sword? Fandral fights the Giant with his broken sword. The Jotun then lunges at Fandral, who ducks just in time, grabs hol the Giant's sword and redirects it, stabbing the Giant through with his own weapon. The Jotun staggers back, then reaches down and swipes at pool of water, sending up a spray that freezes in mid-air forming into an ICE STALAGMITE. It impales Fandral, rendering him helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 29A. Loki races towards the impaled Fandral, throwing daggers felling Frost Giants as he goes. He reaches the nearly- unconscious warrior, when other Jotuns approach. He fight them off. Volstagg looks across the plaza and sees the impaled Fand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unfortunate. He hurries to his wounded comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may need a bit of help. Not a good look, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just try not to bleed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flawless. Volstagg begins to pull the bleeding Fandral off the ice stalagmite. Loki plunges two daggers into the chest of one of the Fro Giants. The Giant grabs hold of Loki's gloved wrists. Loki pulls hands free of the gloves, which are still in the Giant's grasp, revealing Loki's skin beneath. The wounded Jotun s his chance, grabs hold of Loki's bare arm. Loki looks at his arm, prepared for the worst. But instea of the blackness of necrotizing flesh, Loki's arm turns B -- like the Frost Giant's own skin. The blueness spreads painlessly up Loki's arm. He stares at it, confused. The Frost Giant is thrown as well, distracted by the unexpected phenomenon. Loki takes advantage of the distraction, KICKS the Giant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 30. Thor continues fighting, his blood lust rising. He taunts the Jotuns around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! But when he hurls his hammer to take out a Jotun, the Fro Giants seize the opportunity. A group of Jotuns swarm Tho from all sides, keeping him separate from his weapon. Mjolnir falls to the ground. A Frost Giant desperately struggles to lift Mjolnir off t ground, to no avail. Now free, the wounded Fandral looks relieved as Volstagg slings him over his shoulder, and the warriors start to leave. From his balcony, Laufey looks upon the battlefield, deci it's time to pull out the big guns. He touches a wall of palace. An ENERGY WAVE sweeps from his touch, across the wall of the palace, and down to the ground below. The Asgardians hear a foreboding CRACK OF ICE below their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it could! Might be an early spring! They look down, suddenly filled with dread when they see shadowy figures moving in the ice -- dozens of JOTUN WARR awakening beneath the surface, rousing to join the battle Loki turns to his brother, who battles a group of the Gia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor, we must go! Thor, still without his hammer, fights his Jotun foes mercilessly, a man consumed by blood lust. Loki sees the look on his brother's face -- the savage thrill of the he of battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are too many of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stop them! The others hesitate. Jotuns break up through the ice all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor! But Thor ignores his comrades, continues fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! Reluctantly, the group flees back toward the inner edge o the planet as the Giants break up through the ice and giv chase. Thor battles valiantly, but there's just too many of them The Frost Giants swarm him from all sides now, as he disappears beneath a pile of blue flesh and ice. After a

dialogues.speaker: THOR'S FIST
dialogues.text: Forces its way up through the middle of the pile of Jotun He opens his hand, beckoning. One of Thor's attackers hears something ROARING up behind him. He whirls around -- BAM! -- Mjolnir nails him square the face, then flies into Thor's outstretched hand. Thor raises the hammer up high, and brings it down on the grou with all his might. KRAKABOOM! Lightning strikes down from the sky, the hamme channeling the blast, firing the electricity out at the Jotuns around him. They're blasted back in a massive shockwave. The Jotuns convulse, drop dead to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 32. But the force of the blast also cracks the ice below, the shockwave continuing to spread outwards. It moves out to where his comrades are running, breaking up the ground beneath them, exposing the black void of space below.

dialogues.speaker: VOLSTAGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's Thor done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likely killed us all! As the Jotuns race towards the Asgardians, they open thei mouths wide and breathe out an ICY FOG. The swirling mist quickly engulf the fleeing Asgardians before them. The Asgardians stand in the mist, unable to see. Hogun ta a step back, the ice cracking beneath him. They dare not move, for fear of falling through, into the void below. Thor sees he's put his friends in even greater danger. He raises Mjolnir high, SUMMONING THE WINDS. They lift him o the ground and carry him across the frozen wasteland to h comrades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor lands beside his comrades in the shroud of mists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loki, we have to see. Loki raises his arms, concentrates, the mists dissipating But as they do, the Asgardians see before them the faces the Frost Giants. And there are HUNDREDS of them -- too many, even for a Thunder God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, could you bring the mists back, please? Thor realizes that he and his comrades are as good as dea The Giants move in for the kill, when they hear a deafeni ROAR. A hole in the sky opens up, and the Bifrost blasts down onto the inner edge of the planet. Out of the maelst comes the sound of THUNDERING HOOVES, and, to the shock o all, tearing across the frozen wasteland comes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astride his powerful, eight-legged steed SLEIPNIR. He's c in battle armor, Gungnir in his hand -- an imposing sight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 32A. The Giants part in fear as he thunders into their ranks, stopping before Laufey and the Asgardians. Laufey slams his fists into the ground, and the ice benea his feet raises him towards Odin. The Asgardians start to react, thinking it's an attack, but Laufey just stands fa to-face with Odin. Asgardian and Jotun alike look on uneasily, unsure what's about to happen. Laufey sizes up Odin, notices that as powerful as the Allfather still is, the years have taken their toll. He's not the foe he once was. The two rulers talk quietly, out earshot of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laufey. End this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boy sought this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. These are the actions of a boy. Treat them as such. You and I can stop this before there's further bloodshed. Unseen by Odin and the others, Laufey starts to form an i blade at the end of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are beyond diplomacy now, Allfather. He'll get what he came for -- war and death. Odin looks grim, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it. Without warning, Laufey swings his ice blade at Odin, but Odin is quicker. The Allfather brings his spear down upon the ice. Laufey and the nearest Jotuns go falling backwar in a wave, the ice cracking beneath their feet. The other Frost Giants turn tail and run. Thor watches th fleeing Jotuns with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! We'll finish them together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence! Odin raises his spear. The hole in the sky opens, the Bifrost energy blasting forth from it. The Bifrost envelo the Asgardians, yanks them off the ground and up through hole. The vortex closes behind them as all falls silent. Laufey stares up after them contemptuously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heimdall stands at the Observatory controls. Odin pulls Heimdall's sword from the control panel and throws it to Heimdall backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you bring us back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what you've done? What you've started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 33A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was protecting my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot protect your friends. How can you hope to protect a kingdom? Odin turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him to the healing room! Sif, Volstagg, and Hogun hurry to help Fandral out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be a kingdom to protect if you're afraid to act! Odin stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: THOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever the cost, the world must know that the new King of Asgard will not be held in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pride and vanity that talks! Not leadership! Have you forgotten everything I've taught you? What of a warrior's patience, cunning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you wait and be patient, the Nine Realms laugh at us! The old ways are done. You'd stand giving speeches while Asgard falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a vain, greedy, cruel boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are an old man and a fool! The whole world seems to stop at Thor's words. Odin falls quiet. When he speaks again, there's something terrifying beneath the calmness of his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fool, yes! I was a fool to think you were ready. Loki takes a step towards Odin imploringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 34A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin turns and gives Loki a look which stops him in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor Odinson... You have disobeyed the express command of your King. Through your arrogance and stupidity, you have opened these peaceful Realms and innocent lives to the horrors of war. The Allfather plunges Gungnir into Observatory's control panel. The turret turns, the Bifrost energy building alon with Odin's rage. It FIRES, as the Bifrost opens at the e of the platform, creating a portal behind Thor. Odin turns angrily to his son.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are unworthy of this Realm... Odin RIPS a disc off Thor's chest.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...unworthy of your title... He rips away Thor's cloak.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...unworthy of the loved ones you've betrayed. I hereby take from you your powers. Odin extends his hand towards his son. Mjolnir goes flyin from Thor's grasp into Odin's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the name of my father... A FINGER OF LIGHTNING comes off the hammer and hits Thor, disintegrating the right arm of his armor and part of the chest piece.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and of his father before... Another strike disintegrates the remainder of Thor's armo including the cape and torn-away disc on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I cast you out! Odin thrusts Mjolnir before him and -- with a CRACK OF THUNDER -- Thor is hurled backwards into the open Bifrost disappears in the vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 35A. Odin holds Mjolnir in his hand, stares at it bitterly. He closes his eyes, lost in contemplation, whispers somethin quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whosoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor. RUNES appear on the side of the hammer, as if carved into smooth surface. The runes linger for but a moment, then disappear. Suddenly, Odin turns and hurls the hammer into the Bifrost. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor opens his eyes, surrounded by darkness. Suddenly, he blinded by bright headlights of a vehicle -- an SUV. It swerves, the side of it coming straight at him. It SLAMS into him, as we: CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 36. After a beat, we hear familiar voices.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think that was legally your fault.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get the first aid kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, big guy. Do me a favor and don't be dead, okay? Open your eyes and look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor opens his eyes to see Jane Foster staring at him, concerned. She looks vulnerable and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow. Does he need CPR? Because I know CPR.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jane regretfully watches the storm EVAPORATE above their heads. A thought strikes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he come from? They exchange puzzled looks when Thor GROANS again. He si up abruptly, and Jane topples backwards in surprise. Thor staggers groggily to his feet, then turns and offers Jane a hand up. She takes it hesitantly, and he easily pu her up. She can't help but marvel at his strength.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks. Are you okay? Thor searches the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we can tell you're hammered. That's pretty obvious. Jane notices something on the ground around them. She shi her flashlight down at the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 36A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik... look at this. He joins her at her side and sees it. A faint, discernibl pattern is etched into the sand. They exchange a look. Amazed and excited, Jane hurriedly takes out a camera and snaps some photos of the runes. A breeze begins to blow t away.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got to move fast before anything changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 37.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need soil samples, light readings, everything. She pulls out a light meter, holds it up, takes some readings, jots them down in her notebook. Selvig looks at Thor, who stares up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, we need get him to a hospital. Jane kneels and quickly scoops up a soil sample in the cannister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now. It'll take too long. County's an hour away. We'll drop him off after we're done here. Selvig looks uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him, he's fine. Thor stares up at the stars, shouts up at them angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! Heimdall! I know you can hear me! Open the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Selvig's look) Okay, you and Darcy take him to the hospital, I'll stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to leave you alone in the middle of the desert? Thor turns to the others, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! What world is this? The group is intimidated by his fervor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, my friend. We're going to get you some help. Selvig touches Thor's shoulder. Thor shoves him off, grow agitated, belligerent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 37A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?! Answer me! Darcy reaches into her fanny pack, pulls something out of Jane looks on, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik, just back away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thor, calming) You're in the desert outside the town of Puente Antiguo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Realm?! Alfheim? Nornheim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... New Mexico? Darcy raises a TASER at him. Thor looks at the weapon, unsure what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dare threaten Thor with so puny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy fires, the electrified wires shooting out of the ta ZAPPING him in the chest. Thor convulses, falls to the ground unconscious. Jane and Selvig stare at her, shocked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He was freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane still takes soil samples, Darcy and Selvig strugg to drag an unconscious Thor to the SUV and lift him insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time you decide to taser someone, do me a favor and make sure they're already inside the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, come on... Reluctantly, Jane joins the others inside the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV heads off into the distance. Behind it, high overhead, a HOLE opens in the sky. A last blast of Bifros energy bursts forth from it, and a small OBJECT comes fir into our world. It BURNS across the desert sky like a meteor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV sits parked before the emergency room entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selvig watches the unconscious Thor with interest as two ORDERLIES set the Asgardian onto a gurney. Jane and Darcy stand before a sweet, ditzy ADMISSIONS NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it was "Thor." The Nurse painstakingly types it into the computer, one k at a time. Jane watches as Thor is wheeled out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-H-O-R. And your relationship to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met him before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until she hit him with the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazed him, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and we tasered him, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been quite the spat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I don't know him. I just want to make sure he's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need a name and contact number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane Foster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 39A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for God's sake... He reaches over Jane's shoulder and hands the Nurse his business card.

dialogues.speaker: SELVIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Let's go. Selvig, Darcy, and Jane head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor, now in a hospital gown, winces in pain as he awaken a gurney to find a NURSE standing over him, a syringe in arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Just taking a little blood. Thor SLAPS the syringe away angrily, starts to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you attack the son of Odin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
